intro: Chilocarpus torulosus, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a distinctive evergreen plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland forests. Its rhizome system supports the growth of its tall, tree-like structure, while its fronds are used for both ornamental and traditional purposes. Chilocarpus torulosus plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
